column2: Angel, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Maxzide for between 5 and 10 years. It was prescribed for high blood pressure but it has been wonderful drug in controlling my ankles and feet swelling. BUT the drug store has been trying to get it back in stock, it is on back order for the last 4 weeks. Something to do with the manufacturer. W/O having access to Maxzide my legs swell terribly from the knees down. Dr. put me on Bumex and it is awful!!! I've never been so dizzy in my life. Sure hope the drug store and get the Maxzide back in. PS: I had NO side effects using the Maxzide.

column2: CHSSCNATIVE, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I didn't eat in the morning when I started taking this. I was really sick for a week. I finally figured out that I had to either start eating breakfast or take after I ate lunch. I was not overweight before, but I lost 15 lbs from fluids & changing my diet (very low sodium). I have been taking for 3 years and I usually stay within 5-8 pounds of my weight. No side effects at all since I eat before taking now.

column2: Mietzekatze, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got horribly dizzy and drowsy like never before!  I stopped taking it and I am fine.  My usual drug -- triamterene HCTZ Cap 37.5/25MG is "on backorder from all drug manufacturers" -- whatever that means!!!!  Meanwhile, I have gained 5 pounds: pure water.

column2: ladybug63, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Started taking abaout 6 mos ago and has worked great for my HBP as well as for the swelling in my feet and legs.I had cramps, nausea and extreme fatigue at first and then decided to half the pill and now works great for the HBP and swelling.  I do ocassionally get headaches, especially if taken on empty stomach and I agree you do have to urinate often. I also stopped for about 2 weeks and also gained about 3 pounds and swelled right back up immediately. Lost the the 3 lbs though right after I starting taking again. I also discovered while on vacation that I had nausea,headache and extreme sweating while in the sun for very long, cano be sure it was from the Maxzide though as I also take Thyroid medicine.

column2: sboyes60@gmail.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: This drug initially was prescribed for my high blood pressure but had a wonderful side benefit of reducing the swelling in my hands and feet. Highly recommend. I have had no side effects.(except of course increased urination)And I have been taking this for over 2 yrs.

55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 65-74 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: been very happy with it

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: this drug has been effective in helping lower my blood pressure but have several years I have developed gout. There is no history of gout in my family and this is the only thing I have been able to trace it back to.  The doctor didn't have a clue about this drug causing secondary gout or even causing someone with gout to have worse attacks....after reading about this drug i'd reccomend be very closely monitered with blood test to watch for potential damage to your body.

column2: none, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I took this med for many years, initially taking one 25/37.5 tablet daily. About two months ago, my feet started swelling again and my Dr. suggested I try taking two tables daily, which I did without any noticeable side effects.I stopped taking Maxzide recently when my insurance ran out. Over the succeeding two weeks or so I gained 30+ pounds, presumably all water because my feet and legs swelled horribly and I did not change my eating habits.I restarted today, buying the med myself, without insurance (and discovering that the med cost less than the copay my previous insurance required that I pay!) I'm urinating a lot, which I expected, but I hope that the swelling in my feet and legs will not be so bad tonight, and will continue to improve over the next few days.

column2: lawjeang, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: we7734, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: water retention is very much worse.

column2: Motown69, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I Back in the first week of June my wife and I visited a weightloss clinic to lose weight and lower my blood pressure. With the combination of weightloss medication and strict diet for the first 10 days, maxzide lowered my pressure from 182/143 to 143/100 in just 15 days. Recently, it lowered even more to 133/98. this drug really works. However, your intake of water must be consistant throughout the useage of this drug even though it is a diuretic.

column2: writerscramp
column9: After 2 weeks in the hospital with pancreatitis, the doctors attribute it to this drug. No longer taking it, and still recovering from the attack.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This medicine worked just great for me for the first 9 1/2 years. Six months ago, I began to delevop red bumps on both sides of my face. I am using sun screen, but i think I might have to stop using this, which is a shame. My blood pressue have been absolutely perfect since I started taking it. I know if I miss a dose, like others, I gain 3 pounds immediately, but I don't want bumps on my face (which, up until 6 months ago, was smooth and flawless, never ever had acne, always had GREAT skin), which could lead to something more severe. Time to see my doc.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Have been on this for over ten years. BP is fine. Can not stop this w/out gaining 3+ pounds PER DAY. Have lost 40 pounds over the last 3 years and am pretty sure I don't need it for HBP but seem to have kidney function problems when I miss a dose.

column2: Silk, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
swizzy78, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This drug is difficult to take because of constant need for urination, sometimes uncontrollable urination. I have often skipped a dose knowing I will not be near any restrooms. It also makes me quite nauseous.

column2: peaches, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have a little nausea and i have lost weight.

column2: sbchristian, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have swelling of my ankle on the left side only, and after going to several doctors, they gave me lasix and it just did not do anything.  I found a doctor that told me my blood pressure was slightly elevated and he felt the swelling was due to salt intake.  However, after I  stopped using the  salt, it did nothing for my edema in my left foot.  I love this medicine, after a few days of taking it, I am back to normal and feel really good.  I did have some cramping one evening, but I took a low dose of potassium and everything has been wonderful since.  I will be going to a specialist to have a complete blood work up done to see if there are any underlying problems, but if I take this, I feel 30 again.  I am 62.  So, I hope to keep taking it as long as I need it.  My blood pressure was not extremely high to begin with but now it is close to what is considered normal.  I have not had any side affects except for some cramping in my feel the first week of taking, but then it went away.  I highly recommend - it has been a God send to me.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have only taken it for 2 weeks, but my BP has lowered.  Can't see a urination difference.  Dr. just did blood work to check potassium level.  Don't have results yet.  Also take Atenolol.

column2: 25-34 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have meniere's disease and started taking this 5 yrs ago. At first I was very weak and had numbness in my body. But then I added a mulit-vitamin, calcium and postassium supplements and I've been feeling great since! It's cut down my dizzy spells which is a relief. I do get my potassium levels checked twice a year. I highly recommend taking vitamins, it really makes a difference.

column9: I've been on this for twelve years and I have no complaints. It does make me go to the bathroom a lot, but my BP has been great. I'm in the 118/76 range most of the time. I do find that when I miss a dose, I gain 3 pounds of water weight immediately.

column2: Alicat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Maxzide (75 mg tab once daily) very effectively reduced the water retention/swelling in my legs and ankles.  I lost 8 pounds worth of fluid in 2 days!  The only side effect I seem to be experiencing is queasiness and a mild headache, which is continuous.  Not enough to stop taking the meds, though.  I feel this medication is working well for me.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: SWELLING DOWN

column2: ShonnaNa, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Dr had me on multiple meds from Ace Inhibirors to Calcium Channel etc. Nothing worked. Finally, put on Maxide and BP returned to normal within 3 weeks. Has been controlled with no perceptible side-effects for 8 years. I recommend this drug over any other. Also controls swelling. PS: It is generic, so some Dr's try to get you to take specific other ones, if you know what I mean.

column2: Karen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed this for me even though I had had an allergic reaction previously to sulfa drugs (one of the warnings).  When I pointed this out to him he said reactions to this drug were rare.  Now after almost 2 years I am suddenly getting a red rash with burning and itching on my neck, arms, and legs (a known side effect) so I am not going to take it any more.  My doctor already had prescribed an additional drug (Cozaar) since this alone was not enough to control my blood pressure anyway.  Make sure your doctor knows if you have ever had any allergic reaction to any sulfa drugs before taking this medication.

column2: rrrhodes, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for about 6 days. I feel so much better.  I am no longer tired and without energy. column2: Texan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I can't really address "effectiveness" because I've taken the drug for 3 days and started having INTENSE cramps in my legs, feet, and around my ribs after about 24 hours. The pharmacy information sheet said the cramps were a possible side effect & to contact your Dr., so that's where I am. Also, I did not see an increase in urine output during the 3 days I was on the med. But maybe it wasn't long enough to see results yet. I just know the cramps were HORRIBLE, and actually scared me because they were so intense and ongoing.

column9: I have Meniere's Disease, a condition where fluid builds up in my inner ear causing dizziness and vertigo. This greatly helped reduce the fluid, giving me more dizzy-free days. I do have to get my potassium levels tested once or twice a year as this cause the levels to drop.
